nodes.title: Wespire
nodes.content:
I was hired by Wespire to rebuild entirely their WordPress Website and implement new marketing tools as Hubspot.

Collaborating with their designers and Customer Success was a great experience, we managed to improve accessibility and performance by more than 50% leading to an increase of 70% new unique visitors and 150% more conversions on the next quarter!

HTML5 – CSS3 – ES6 JavaScript – jQuery – WordPress – Elementor – OceanWp

View Live

nodes.title: Chatty Cat
nodes.content:
Design and Developement

I developed two versions of this App, one for desktop and one for Iphones with React Native

I used React, React Native and Firebase to create this Cat themed app.

I started by creating an API using Node and Axios to manage the interactions with Firebase then I experimented with functions directly into React and kept this option because it is easier to maintain.

The Firebase interface is very easy to use, the most complicated part were the UI animations and the state management. I used framer motion a lot, an especially useful feature is the positionTransition attribute as it allows us to animate the entry of new components into DOM (when you add a friend for example).

It was my most interesting project so far. I also had a lot of fun entirely designing the UI including the SVGs. Some features are still missing (removing or blocking a friend) but i’m pretty happy with the result.

Features : User Authentication – Animations – UseContext State Management – React Router – Framer Motion

HTML5 – CSS3 – ES6 JavaScript – REACT – REACT NATIVE Firebase

View Live – View Code

nodes.title: WP-Gatsby
nodes.content:
Tags: Gatsby – React – Portfolio – Contact Form – Sliders – Modal Gallery

Design and Developement

In collaboration with Andrew Borstein, software engineer at Wespire, i was asked to transfer the portfolio of Ian McGillivray from wordpress to a faster more modern solution.

He proposed a JAM-stack implementation and we chose Gatsby mainly because of the documentation.

It was awesome to use GraphQL queries and Gatsby-Image even though the implementation on the wordpress side with wordpress-graphQL and Advanced Custom fields was tricky.
I coupled the SQL wordpress database with GraphQL and created brand new and super simple React components to display the Galleries and the Sliders.
It’s now super fast and accessible, users can also update and publish through the WordPress CMS.

We implemented another version without any CMS, just full markdown.

It uses gatsby-node and createPage( ) to dig into the Slider and Gallery directories of each post and uses the images as gallery or slider elements!

The hosting choice was Netlify because of it’s simplicity and the fact that we could both directly work on the GitHub repository.

The form is powered by Getform due to the static nature of Gatsby.

 

Features : JAM Stack Website – Form – Gallery -Modal

WordPress/Gatsby

View Live – View Code

Full MarkDown

View Live – View Code

nodes.title: 2018-2021 Software Engineer
nodes.content:
Websites design and development

  • I’m collaborating at Resolvve.com developing many features for the comments section of their REACT application.
  • I entirely rebuilt the Bostonian Employee Engagement Company WeSpire Website. Collaborating with their content team and designers was amazing! We integrated Hubspot and many other functionalities.
  • I produced several sites for small Businesses in Guadeloupe creating custom templates from scratch or using wordpress themes and/or bootstrap depending on their needs.
  • Developed projects with vanilla JS and different frameworks such as React, Gatsby and modern workflow tools : Saas, GitHub, Gulp, Npm, Node.js. Jump to my Work !

nodes.title: 2017-2018 Digital Pedagogy Advisor in the West Indies
nodes.content:
I was recruited by the academy of Guadeloupe (more than 60 middle and high schools) to :

  • Guide and animate a network of 15 middle-schools and high-schools to improve the integration of digital tools in their pedagogy and functioning.
  • Participate to the strategical decisions making, selecting applications that would suit teacher’s needs and elaborate a formation plan to diffuse their usage.
  • Example : We selected a platform to connect teachers, students and parents, then we tested it in our schools network.

nodes.title: My ambition is to produce optimized code using best practices and following accessibility guidelines!
nodes.content:
I’m committed, motivated, eager to always learn and grow.
Communicating the complexities and the opportunities offered by technical solutions is my favorite thing to do.
I love when a team goes forward, achieve complex projects and take on new challenges.
Education :

Bachelor in Philosophy & Logic
Master in Information/Communication Pedagogy
Fluent in : English – French – Creole

Skills :
Developement :

Languages/Frameworks

  • CSS – using flexbox and grid system
  • HTML – semantic markup and document structure
  • JAVASCRIPT – solid fundations, ES6 Arrow Functions and latest features
  • REACT – using Hooks or Classes
  • Gatsby – to make the web faster
  • WordPress – Custom themes
  • GRAPHQL – SQL – PHP

Work Flow

  • Git – Gulp
  • SASS – SCSS
  • Testing and Code Optimization : lightHouse
Design :
  • Sketch – Adobe Photoshop
  • Some experience in UX/UI
Other Interests :

Globe trotter – Surfer – Musician

nodes.title: WordPress sites
nodes.content:
Design and developement of Custom WordPress Sites.

I have some solid experience taking on projects from start to end, I evaluate their needs and their Business goals, what is their main target ? What is a reasonable objective in terms of visibility and SEO. Do they already have a social media presence ?

How are they going to use their website ? Will they need to update it frequently and are they feeling confortable with a CMS like wordpress ? 

We gather all the available content, wireframe the Information Architecture and basic user flow and then we can switch to designing the website. 

Dealing with clients is always tricky as they often know what they want but rarely what they need! The process is always very interesting  and my teaching and advising experience always comes in very handy!

HTML5 – CSS3 – ES6 JavaScript – WordPress codex

Wespire

EasyKite

SunsetSurfCamp

Design and Developement

Features : UX/UI – Wordpress – HTML5 – ES6 JavaScript – CSS Animation – Flexbox
